Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client for pushing metrics to a Graphite server, with support for periodic pushing and character sanitization for Graphite compatibility.

Class Description: The Graphite class provides functionality to connect to a Graphite server via TCP and push metrics from a CollectorRegistry. It handles character sanitization for Graphite compatibility and supports both one-time pushes and periodic pushing via a daemon thread.

Attributes:
- host: String - The hostname or IP address of the Graphite server
- port: int - The port number of the Graphite server
- logger: Logger - Logger instance for error logging
- INVALID_GRAPHITE_CHARS: Pattern - Regular expression pattern for invalid Graphite characters

Methods:
- Graphite(String host, int port) -> None - Constructor that initializes the Graphite client with server connection details
- push(CollectorRegistry registry) -> void - Pushes all metrics from the registry to Graphite server immediately. Throws IOException if connection fails
- start(CollectorRegistry registry) -> Thread - Starts a daemon thread that pushes metrics every 60 seconds
- start(CollectorRegistry registry, int intervalSeconds) -> Thread - Starts a daemon thread that pushes metrics at specified intervals
- PushThread(CollectorRegistry registry, int intervalSeconds) -> None - Inner class constructor for the periodic push thread
- run() -> void - The main execution method of PushThread that handles periodic metric pushing
